intro: Eleogenus, commonly known as the genus of flowering plants in the family Malvaceae, consists of shrubs and trees native to tropical and subtropical regions. These plants typically have alternate, simple leaves and produce showy, five-petaled flowers. The fruits are usually capsules that split open to release seeds. Eleogenus species are often found in moist, well-drained soils and can thrive in a variety of light conditions. They are valued for their ornamental qualities and sometimes for their fibers or medicinal properties.
